Module it.polimi.ingsw.PSP43
Package it.polimi.ingsw.PSP43.server.controller.gameStates

Class GameSessionObservable

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.PSP43.server.controller.gameStates.GameSessionObservable
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
GameSession
public class GameSessionObservable
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
This abstract class (extended by GameSession) is the main access for all the players who want to join a game.

      public void setCurrentState​(TurnState currentState)
      This method sets the effective state in which the game is.
      Parameters:
      currentState - the effective state in which the game is.

    • getListenersHashMap

      public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​ClientListener> getListenersHashMap()
      This method returns a map where the key is the name of a player and the value is the related ClientListener.
      Returns:
      a map where the key is the name of a player and the value is the related ClientListener.

    • registerToTheGame

      public int registerToTheGame​(RegistrationMessage message, ClientListener player)
      This method is called by every player who wants to join the game. In particular it is called by a ClientListener, when it finds that the number of max. players is still by default "1" or if the max. number of players is greater than the number of players enrolled to the game.
      Parameters:
      message - The message of registration arrived from the net and caught by the ClientListener.
      player - The ClientListener which called this method.
      Returns:
      the id of the game.

    • unregisterFromGame

      public void unregisterFromGame​(LeaveGameMessage message, ClientListener player)
      This method is called at any time of the game by a player and causes the end of the game by sending to all the players a EndGameMessage.
      Parameters:
      message - The message which contains the reason of the end of the game (here because of connection problems or exit of a player)
      player - The ClientListener which called the method and so the one to which the method hasn't to send the EndGameMessage.

    • eliminatePlayer

      public void eliminatePlayer​(Player playerEliminated, PlayersListMessage messageToOthers)
      This method is called when a player looses the game. It sends him a EndGameMessage and eliminates his ClientListener from the HashMap in which it was saved.
      Parameters:
      playerEliminated - The data of the player who lost the game.
      messageToOthers - The message to be sent to all other players to updated their list of players of the game.

    • sendEndingMessage

      public void sendEndingMessage​(EndGameMessage messageToLosers, EndGameMessage messageForTheWinner, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> nicksExcluded)
      This method is used when tha game finishes because one of the players wins.
      Parameters:
      messageToLosers - The message sent to all the losers of the game, containing the name of the winner.
      messageForTheWinner - The message sent to the winner of the game.
      nicksExcluded - The winner player which has to receive messageForTheWinner.

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage​(ServerMessage genericMessage, java.lang.String addressee)
      This method is called to send to the client a generic message, which doesn't pretend an answer.
      Parameters:
      genericMessage - The message to be sent.
      addressee - The client to which the message has to be sent.

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage​(EndGameMessage endGameMessage, java.lang.String addressee)
      This method is called to send to the client the message to tell him that the game is ended (for different reasons, always saved into its String field).
      Parameters:
      endGameMessage - The message to be sent.
      addressee - The client to which the message has to be sent.

    • sendBroadCast

      public void sendBroadCast​(ServerMessage message)
      This method sends to all the players a generic message.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to be sent.

    • sendBroadCast

      public void sendBroadCast​(ServerMessage message, java.lang.String nickExcluded)
      This method sends to all the players the message, excluded the ones in the list passed as parameter.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to be sent.
      nickExcluded - The player's nickname excluded from receiving the message.

    • sendBroadCast

      public void sendBroadCast​(EndGameMessage endGameMessage, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> nicksExcluded)
      This method sends the EndGameMessage to all the players, telling them the end of the game. All the players in the list passed as parameter are excluded.
      Parameters:
      endGameMessage - The message to be sent.
      nicksExcluded - The list of players excluded from receiving the message.

    • sendRequest

      public <T extends ClientMessage> T sendRequest​(ServerMessage message, java.lang.String addressee, java.lang.Class<T> typeExpected) throws GameEndedException
      This method is used to send a request to the client and to wait for a response.
      Type Parameters:
      T - A sub-type of ClientMessage.
      Parameters:
      message - The request message sent.
      addressee - The player who has to receive the message.
      typeExpected - The type of message that the caller is expecting.
      Returns:
      a response from the client.
      Throws:
      GameEndedException - if the client has disconnected while he was asked by this method.
